intro: Rubus bogotensis brasiliensis, commonly known as the Bogotá blackberry, is a species of bramble native to the Andean regions of South America. It is characterized by its thorny stems and compound leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, dark purple to black berries that are typically edible. It thrives in moist, temperate climates and is often found in high-altitude forests. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
